Title: Frontal lobe connections of the superior temporal sulcus in the rhesus monkey.
Abstract: The frontal lobe connections of different architectonic areas of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in the rhesus monkey were investigated with the aid of both anterograde and retrograde tracing techniques. The proisocortical area in the rostralmost STS connects with proisocortical regions on the ventral and medial surfaces of the frontal lobe. The frontal lobe projections of polymodal cortex (area TPO) in the upper bank of the STS are organized according to the rostral-to-caudal topography of the sulcus. Rostral TPO interconnects with ventral (areas 13, 12, 11, and 14), medial (areas 24, 32, 14, and 9), and lateral (areas 10, 12, and 46) sectors of the frontal lobe. The mid-portion of polymodal cortex projects to, and receives fibers from, rostral subdivisions of lateral prefrontal cortex, viz. dorsal area 46, areas 9 and 10, whereas the caudal segment of TPO has reciprocal connections with caudal subdivisions (areas 46, 8, and 6) of the lateral frontal lobe. Visual-related zones (areas TEa and TEm) in the rostral lower bank of the STS have connectional relationships with orbitofrontal areas 11 and 12 and lateral frontal areas 46 and 8. A presumed somatic sensory-related area in the rostral depth of the STS (area IPa) projects to orbital (areas 11 and 14) and lateral (areas 46, 10, and 12) sectors of the frontal lobe.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Region_Parcellation: Prefrontal cortex, superior and inferotemporal cortex
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation:
"STS injection sites were located architectonically in terms of the schema of Seltzer and Pandya ('78) (Fig. 1B,C). Sites of terminal labelling and labelled neurons in the frontal lobe were located according to the parcellation of Walker ('40), with modifications as suggested by Barbas and Pandya ('82) (Fig.1A)." (p. 99)
"Fig.1.   A: Diagrams of te lateral, medial, and inferior (ventral, or orbital) surfaces of the frontal lobe in acaca Mulatta to show the architectonic parcellation of Walker ('40) as modified by Barbas and Pandya ('82).
...B: Diagram of the lateral surface of the cerebral hemisphere to show the architectonic parcellation of the superior temporal sulcus (STS; enclosed within heavy dark lines), superior temporal gyrus, and inferotemporal region, according to the studies of Seltzer and Pandya ('78) and Pandya and Sanides ('73)" (p. 99, legend of figure 1)

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation:
"Caudal portions of areas TPO and PGa fall within what other authors have termed area "MST" (Desimone and Ungerleider, '86; Maunsell and van Essen, '83; Ungerleider and Desimone, '86a,b)." (p. 99)
"..., designated "area OAa." This cortical zone receives input from both primary visual and visual association (peristriate) cortexes and appears to contain the extrastriate visual area "MT" as well as area "FST" (desimone and Ungerleider, '86; Ungerleider and Desimone, '86a,b)." (p. 100)

@Injections.Citation: "Case 1-ARG had the rostralmost injection of radiolabelled amino acids, involving areas Pro and TPO within the sulcus, as well as portions of areas Ts1 and Ts2 of the adjacent superior temporal gyrus (Fig. 2A)." p. 100

"Proceeding caudally for a short distance, two other monkeys, cases 10- and 11-ARG, also had isotope injections in the lower bank of the STS (areas TEa and TEm). Case 10-ARG`s injection (Fig. 2A), however, involved a portion of inferotemporal cortex (areas TE1 and TE2) while the injection in case 11-ARG (Fig. 2B), though restricted to sulcal cortex, spread to involve the upper bank (area TPO)." p. 105

"Proceeding caudally for a short distance, two other monkeys, cases 10- and 11-ARG, also had isotope injections in the lower bank of the STS (areas TEa and TEm). "Monkeys 12- and 13-ARG received isotope injections which were situated in a more caudal portion of the lower bank of the STS, yet still within the boundaries of areas TEa and TEm (Fig. 2B). The injection in case 12-ARG staddled the lower lip of the sulcus and spread into inferotemporal cortex (area TE3)." p. 105

"Case 3-ARG had a small injection in areas TPO and TAa at approximately the same level as in case 2-ARG, but with considerable involvement of the adjacent superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts2 and Ts3) (Fig. 2B)." p. 101

"Cases 4- and 5-ARG both had isotope injections in this segment of area TPO. publication.title: Frontal lobe connections of the superior temporal sulcus in the rhesus monkey.
publication.abstract: The frontal lobe connections of different architectonic areas of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in the rhesus monkey were investigated with the aid of both anterograde and retrograde tracing techniques. The proisocortical area in the rostralmost STS connects with proisocortical regions on the ventral and medial surfaces of the frontal lobe. The frontal lobe projections of polymodal cortex (area TPO) in the upper bank of the STS are organized according to the rostral-to-caudal topography of the sulcus. Rostral TPO interconnects with ventral (areas 13, 12, 11, and 14), medial (areas 24, 32, 14, and 9), and lateral (areas 10, 12, and 46) sectors of the frontal lobe. The mid-portion of polymodal cortex projects to, and receives fibers from, rostral subdivisions of lateral prefrontal cortex, viz. dorsal area 46, areas 9 and 10, whereas the caudal segment of TPO has reciprocal connections with caudal subdivisions (areas 46, 8, and 6) of the lateral frontal lobe. Visual-related zones (areas TEa and TEm) in the rostral lower bank of the STS have connectional relationships with orbitofrontal areas 11 and 12 and lateral frontal areas 46 and 8. A presumed somatic sensory-related area in the rostral depth of the STS (area IPa) projects to orbital (areas 11 and 14) and lateral (areas 46, 10, and 12) sectors of the frontal lobe.
